title: CLASS_INSTANCES view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs:
This Information Schema view displays a row for each class
instance in a database.
Name of the schema the instance belongs to.
Name of the database the instance belongs to.
Name of the class the instance is instantiated from.
Name of the schema of the class the instance is instantiated from.
Name of the database of the class the instance is instantiated from.
Name of the role that owns the instance.

The type of role that owns the object, for example ROLE. . If a Snowflake Native App owns the object, the value is APPLICATION. . Snowflake returns NULL if you delete the object because a deleted object does not have an owner role.
Date and time when the instance was created.
The view only displays objects for which the current role for the session has been granted access privileges.

The view does not include instances that have been dropped. To view dropped instances, use
the Account Usage CLASS_INSTANCES view instead.
Retrieve the names of all instances, and the class they were instantiated from, in the mydatabase database:
